Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Phase II: Dynamically Assessing Network Security Policy Compliance with NP-Live
Award.AbstractNarration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project results from it significantly strengthening the ability of network operators and security administrators to implement the correct set of rules to keep critical assets out of reach of cyber adversaries. The power grid has been said to be the most important engineering achievement of humankind. Modern civilisation depends on electricity at such an intrinsic level that we cannot imagine a world without it. In fact, disruptions of power infrastructures quickly lead to chaotic situations in which human lives are at risk. Now that power grid control centers are relying on IT infrastructures, it has become of the utmost importance to ensure the resiliency of systems and networks through methodical IT security protection, monitoring, and response. Through automated continuous verification technologies, this project has a direct impact on the capabilities of our nation to improve its resiliency. The benefit to the power industry, to computer science security, and for society at large is a technological advance to improve the security of our most important resources.

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project plans to develop a constructive approach to providing cyber security. Cyber security tools are often driven by the necessity to respond to market demand without having the time and resources to develop the proper formalisms and algorithms to solve long-term issues. The innovation proposed here is uniquely positioned to change this paradigm thanks to having roots in both a fundamental academic background and an extensive collaboration with industry partners. Consequently, this project responds to critical customer needs while providing innovations in science, technology, and engineering of critical infrastructure security. The approach taken to compliance assessment has been evaluated in the field and provides a basis for new research leading to theoretically sound solutions to network security modeling, and further development of innovative and provably correct algorithms and tools for accurate and scalable cyber security assessment under real industry constraints.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This research and development project that started in 2014 has introduced an innovative approach to change the way information technology security and compliance officers understand and verify the security of their network by providing a working model-based and online security assessment solution. This technology uses device configurations and real-time observations to create a virtual network representation that accurately predicts how packets traverse the network, dynamically updates the state of the network model as configurations change, automatically trains a system to develop global policy rules that defines compliance in a machine checkable form, and provides real-time analysis of global policy. This process leads to unprecedented model accuracy that directly supports network security policy analysis and decision-making. The benefits for network administrators and security operators is to gain higher confidence in their asset security, a greater ability to communicate how their system meets regulatory requirements, as well as to save time and resources by being able to prioritize vulnerability mitigation along with significantly reducing the volume of false alerts. This research is implemented in a software product called NP-Live, designed to meet the need for security and information assurance of networks.


The impact of this project is particularly significant in the context of critical infrastructures and the energy industry. The electric sector has responded to the challenge of securing and protecting their cyber assets by mandating critical infrastructure protection regulations to be followed by all large electric utilities. Every year, several utilities receive penalties of up to $1,000,000 a day because of violations found in the security of their network following an audit. NP-Live is designed to support utilities and auditors in assessing whether their networks are secure and in compliance with Government NERC/CIP regulations (NERC stands for North American Electric Reliability Corporation and CIP stands for Critical Infrastructure Protection).


The team at Network Perception completed the objectives of this project by successfully designing, developing, and commercializing NP-Live. The software can import configuration files from firewalls, routers, and switches of most major device manufacturers. NP-Live can also infer the topology of a network, and run path analysis continuously to generate timely alerts when security and compliance issues are detected. The backend architecture and the frontend interface have built in adaptability to new features and new environments. The usability of NP-Live enables both experts and novices to instantly understand complex network architecture and multi-layered security policies in order to ensure compliance with cyber security standards and best practices.
